TEXT.citation: Indosan, S., Wakelin, G., Dararyaw, S., and Kalaku, S. (1958). Yami texts. Work Papers of the Summer Institute of Linguistics, University of North Dakota Session: Vol. 2, Article 7. 10.31356/silwp.vol02.07
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @article{indosan1958yami, title={Yami texts}, year={1958}, author={Indosan, Samen and Wakelin, Grace and Dararyaw, Sinan and Kalaku, Saman}, journal={Work Papers of the Summer Institute of Linguistics, University of North Dakota Session}, volume={2}, number={7}, doi={10.31356/silwp.vol02.07}

S.FORM: amyan su tau? nu-kakwa i-m-angay mang-aep su uvi?
amyan so tao? no-kakwa i-m-angay mang-aep so ovi?
S.TRANSL: A long time ago, there was a person who went to get some potatoes.

S.FORM: kwan-a nu anak-ne-m tu-lavi? s-ina s-ina kwan-a
kwan-a no anak-ne-m to-lavi? s-ina s-ina kwan-a

S.TRANSL: the child said to his father,

S.FORM: yana-ni-aep nu kangkang lu kuang kwan-a
yana-ni-aep no kangkang lo koang kwan-a
S.TRANSL: The rooster took her far away."

S.FORM: maniring s-ama-na-m uyuda nana-ni-aep nu kangkang
maniring s-ama-na-m oyoda nana-ni-aep no kangkang
S.TRANSL: The father said, "Oh, the rooster took her!"

S.FORM: k-angay-da-rana lu tatala kalagen s-ina-na lu ilaud
k-angay-da-rana lo tatala kalagen s-ina-na lo ilaod
S.TRANSL: and they went to the boat to hunt for the mother in a foreign country.

S.FORM: y-amyan lu chia? su tau? kwan-ta
y-amyan lo chia? so tao? kwan-ta
S.TRANSL: "Is there anyone (of our own people) here?"

S.FORM: kwan-ta nu tau? uri? lu ya-makarang a-takakal
kwan-ta no tao? ori? lo ya-makarang a-takakal

S.TRANSL: the child said, "Here you are, Mother!"
"You are not my child," said his mother.

S.FORM: kwan-a nu anak-ne-m buken a s-ina-ku-imu kwan-a
kwan-a no anak-ne-m boken a s-ina-ko-imo kwan-a
S.TRANSL: "Then you are not my mother?" said the child.

S.FORM: maniring u anak-ne-m ni-salep-na-imu nu kangkang nu k-angay-ta mang-ali su uvi? siu? kwan-a
maniring o anak-ne-m ni-salep-na-imo no kangkang no k-angay-ta mang-ali so ovi? sio? kwan-a
S.TRANSL: "The rooster took you when we went to get some potatoes a long time ago."

S.FORM: maniring s-ina-na-m ning kwan-a nuyud-ku-imu a anak-em mangwat-kamu su chinwat kwan-a
maniring s-ina-na-m ning kwan-a noyod-ko-imo a anak-em mangwat-kamo so chinwat kwan-a
S.TRANSL: His mother said, "If it's true you are my child, when boiling water is thrown on you
We'll see if you'll be killed."

S.FORM: taktakana-rana u anak-na nu chinwat-em tongwus
taktakana-rana o anak-na no chinwat-em tongwos
S.TRANSL: Boiling water was thrown on her child.

S.FORM: maniring u ina-na-m manuyung a anak-u-imu kwan-a
maniring o ina-na-m manoyong a anak-o-imo kwan-a
S.TRANSL: "You're truly my child!" said his mother.

S.FORM: mai-rana sira lu vagay-ta machyura u ina-na
mai-rana sira lo vagay-ta machyora o ina-na
S.TRANSL: and returned to their house accompanied by the mother.

S.FORM: maniring u ana-na-m mang-aep ta-ka-mu su vatu kwan-a
maniring o ana-na-m mang-aep ta-ka-mo so vato kwan-a
S.TRANSL: His father said, "Let's take some stones

S.FORM: y-atey-ta su vagay-ta ta-manginanawa ta-ka-mu di-mai kwan-a
y-atey-ta so vagay-ta ta-manginanawa ta-ka-mo di-mai kwan-a
S.TRANSL: and make the stone walls of our house, but be careful."

S.FORM: ka-pangay-ta su aru dinalulut lu vagay-ta
ka-pangay-ta so aro dinalolot lo vagay-ta
S.TRANSL: Then they put many spirit-weapons in their house

S.FORM: mai-rana lu kangkang-em apwapwasena u atey-na lu vagay-ta
mai-rana lo kangkang-em apwapwasena o atey-na lo vagay-ta
S.TRANSL: They went to the rooster's house and took stones from his house to their house (unctn).

S.FORM: ingunguna u katawtaw-na-m m-angay-rana lu ilaud u kangkang
ingongona o katawtaw-na-m m-angay-rana lo ilaod o kangkang
S.TRANSL: The rooster had gone to a foreign country.
